en: Talk is cheap. Show me the code.
author: Linus Torvalds

en: Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute.
author: Hal Abelson

en: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.
author: Martin Fowler

en: Truth can only be found in one place: the code.
author: Robert C. Martin

en: First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.
author: John Johnson

en: Experience is the name everyone gives to their mistakes.
author: Oscar Wilde

en: In order to be irreplaceable, one must always be different.
author: Coco Chanel

en: Java is to JavaScript what car is to Carpet.
author: Chris Heilmann

en: Knowledge is power.
author: Francis Bacon

en: Sometimes it pays to stay in bed on Monday, rather than spending the rest of the week debugging Monday’s code.
author: Dan Salomon

en: Perfection is achieved not when there is nothing more to add, but rather when there is nothing more to take away.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

en: Code is like humor. When you have to explain it, it’s bad.
author: Cory House

en: Fix the cause, not the symptom.
author: Steve Maguire

en: Optimism is an occupational hazard of programming: feedback is the treatment.
author: Kent Beck

en: Simplicity is the soul of efficiency.
author: Austin Freeman

en: Before software can be reusable it first has to be usable.
author: Ralph Johnson

en: Make it work, make it right, make it fast.
author: Kent Beck

en: Programs are meant to be read by humans and only incidentally for computers to execute.
author: Donald Knuth

en: Give a man a program, frustrate him for a day. Teach a man to program, frustrate him for a lifetime.
author: Muhammad Waseem

en: The most disastrous thing you can ever learn is your first programming language.
author: Alan Kay

en: Programming is the art of algorithm design and the craft of debugging errant code.
author: Ellen Ullman

en: The best error message is the one that never shows up.
author: Thomas Fuchs

en: Deleted code is debugged code.
author: Jeff Sickel

en: Software undergoes beta testing shortly before it’s released. Beta is Latin for 'still doesn’t work'.
author: Anonymous

en: Programming today is a race between software engineers striving to build bigger and better idiot-proof programs, and the universe trying to produce bigger and better idiots. So far, the universe is winning.
author: Rick Cook

en: There are only two kinds of programming languages: those people always bitch about and those nobody uses.
author: Bjarne Stroustrup

en: The most important property of a program is whether it accomplishes the intention of its user.
author: C.A.R. Hoare

en: Controlling complexity is the essence of computer programming.
author: Brian Kernighan

en: Good code is its own best documentation.
author: Steve McConnell

en: Any code of your own that you haven’t looked at for six or more months might as well have been written by someone else.
author: Eagleson's Law

en: If debugging is the process of removing bugs, then programming must be the process of putting them in.
author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

en: Computers are fast; programmers keep it slow.
author: Anonymous

en: A good programmer is someone who always looks both ways before crossing a one-way street.
author: Doug Linder

en: The computer was born to solve problems that did not exist before.
author: Bill Gates

en: Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute.
author: Harold Abelson

en: Code never lies, comments sometimes do.
author: Ron Jeffries

en: A language that doesn’t affect the way you think about programming is not worth knowing.
author: Alan Perlis

en: Don't comment bad code—rewrite it.
author: Brian W. Kernighan

en: Walking on water and developing software from a specification are easy if both are frozen.
author: Edward V. Berard

en: Programming isn't about what you know; it's about what you can figure out.
author: Chris Pine

en: The cleaner the code, the fewer the bugs.
author: Anonymous

en: The function of good software is to make the complex appear simple.
author: Grady Booch

en: Don’t worry if it doesn’t work right. If everything did, you’d be out of a job.
author: Mosher’s Law

en: One man’s crappy software is another man’s full-time job.
author: Jessica Gaston

en: Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic.
author: Arthur C. Clarke

en: Programming is like writing a book... except when you miss a single comma on page 126 the whole thing makes no damn sense.
author: Unknown

en: There is no problem in computer science that cannot be solved by another level of indirection.
author: David Wheeler

en: Without requirements or design, programming is the art of adding bugs to an empty text file.
author: Louis Srygley

en: A user interface is like a joke. If you have to explain it, it’s not that good.
author: Martin LeBlanc

en: Software is like entropy: It is difficult to grasp, weighs nothing, and obeys the Second Law of Thermodynamics; i.e., it always increases.
author: Norman Augustine
